roleset.name: store, keeping for later use
roleset.note: STORE-V NOTES: Based on financial supbcorpus. Comparison with 'stock'. Member of Vncls keep-15.2. (from store.01-v)
STORAGE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on store-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls keep-15.2. (from storage.01-n)

roles.note: Arg2-beneficiary replaced by arg2-location, based on expected frequency of use and VN. (from storage.01-n)

example.name: cutting-edge technology
example.text: Although it is not the first company to produce the thinner drives, which-1 *trace*-1 store information in personal computers, MiniScribe says it is the first with an 80-megabyte drive; the company plans to introduce a 120-megabyte drive next year.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: Operationally, Maxtor benefited from robust sales of products that-1 *trace*-1 store data for high-end personal computers and computer workstations.
example.arg: for high-end personal computers and computer workstations

example.name: Location as object, with reduced relative
example.text: The city was basking in eternal sunshine at the foot of mountains stored *T* with endless riches and resources.

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: Maintain a 50-foot buffer zone from the facility boundary for container storage of ignitable or reactive wastes.

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Fungi resemble animals not only in their mode of nutrition, but in their storage of digestive nutritive materials.

example.name: redundant particle
example.text: At the same time he-1 started walking the streets , [*-1] peering at the people passing or shopping at the stalls , storing up fresh impressions of what they looked like , how they moved .
example.arg: fresh impressions of what they looked like , how they moved
